  119: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  120: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  121: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  122: 
  123: %% suite() ->
  124: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  125: 
  126: suite() ->
  127:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  128: 
  129: all() ->
  130:     [
  131:      {group, openssh},
  132:      small_interrupted_send,
  133:      interrupted_send,
  134:      manual_window_handling,
  135:      auto_window_handling,
  136:      exec_erlang_term,
  137:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  138:      exec_disabled,
  139:      exec_shell_disabled,
  140:      start_shell,
  141:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  142:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  143:      trap_exit_connect,
  144:      trap_exit_daemon,
  145:      start_shell_pty,
  146:      start_shell_exec,
  147:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  148:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  149:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  150:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  151:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  152:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  153:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data,
  154:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  155:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  156:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  157:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  158:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  159:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  160:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  161:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  162:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  163:      connect2_invalid_options,
  164:      connect_invalid_port,
  165:      connect_invalid_options,
  166:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  167:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  168:      connect3_invalid_port,
  169:      connect3_invalid_options,
  170:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  171:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  172:      connect3_invalid_both,
  173:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  174:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  175:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  176:      connect4_invalid_three,
  177:      connect_timeout,
  178:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  179:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  180:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  181:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  182:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  183:      kex_error,
  184:      stop_listener,
  185:      no_sensitive_leak,
  186:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  187:      max_channels_option
  188:     ].
  189: groups() ->
  190:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  191: 
  192: payload() ->
  193:     [simple_exec,
  194:      simple_exec_more_data,
  195:      simple_exec_sock,
  196:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  197:      small_cat,
  198:      big_cat,
  199:      send_after_exit].
  200: 
  201: ptty() ->
  202:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  203:      ptty_alloc,
  204:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  205: 
  206: sock() ->
  207:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  208:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  209:     ].
  210: 
  211: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  212: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  213:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  214:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  215:         | Config]
  216:       ).
  217: 
  218: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  219:     catch ssh:stop(),
  220:     ok.
  221: 
  222: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  223: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  224:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  225: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  226: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  227: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  228: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  229: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  230:     end;
  231: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  232:     Config.
  233: 
  234: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  235:     Config.
  236: 
  237: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  238: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  239:     PktSize = 1024, % 1KiB
  240:     NewConfig = case TestCase of
  241:         manual_window_handling ->
  242:             [{init_win_size, 2 * PktSize}, {init_pkt_size, PktSize},
  243:              {window_handling_mode, manual},
  244:              {adjust_timeout, 2000} | Config];
  245:         auto_window_handling ->
  246:             [{init_win_size, 2 * PktSize}, {init_pkt_size, PktSize},
  247:              {window_handling_mode, auto},
  248:              {adjust_timeout, 2000} | Config];
  249:         _ -> Config
  250:     end,
  251:     ssh:stop(),
  252:     ssh:start(),
  253:     {ok, TestLogHandlerRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  254:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(NewConfig),
  255:     [{log_handler_ref, TestLogHandlerRef} | NewConfig].
  256: 
  257: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  258:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(
  259:                      proplists:get_value(log_handler_ref, Config)),
  260:     EventCnt = length(Events),
  261:     {ok, InterestingEventCnt} = analyze_events(Events, EventCnt),
  262:     VerificationResult = verify_events(TestCase, InterestingEventCnt),
  263:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  264:     ssh:stop(),
  265:     VerificationResult.
  266: 
  267: analyze_events(_, 0) ->
  268:     {ok, 0};
  269: analyze_events(Events, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0 ->
  270:     {ok, Cnt} = print_interesting_events(Events, 0),
  271:     case Cnt > 0 of
  272:         true ->
  273:             ct:comment("(logger stats) interesting: ~p boring: ~p",
  274:                        [Cnt, EventNumber - Cnt]);
  275:         _ ->
  276:             ct:comment("(logger stats) boring: ~p",
  277:                        [length(Events)])
  278:     end,
  279:     AllEventsSummary = lists:flatten([process_event(E) || E <- Events]),
  280:     ct:log("~nTotal logger events: ~p~nAll events:~n~s", [EventNumber, AllEventsSummary]),
  281:     {ok, Cnt}.
  282: 
  283: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  284:                         #{label := Label,
  285:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  286:                                      {Status, Properties}]}},
  287:                 level := Level}) ->
  288:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  289: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  290:                         #{label := Label,
  291:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  292:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  293:                                      {reason, {Status, _ReasonDetails}},
  294:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  295:                 level := Level}) ->
  296:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  297: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  298:                         #{label := Label,
  299:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  300:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  301:                                      {reason, Status},
  302:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  303:                 level := Level}) ->
  304:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  305: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  306:                         #{label := Label,
  307:                           report := [Properties, []]}},
  308:                 level := Level}) ->
  309:     {status, Status} = get_value(status, Properties),
  310:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  311:     Id = get_value(registered_name, Properties),
  312:     {initial_call, {M, F, Args}} = get_value(initial_call, Properties),
  313:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s)~n",
  314:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  315:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args]]);
  316: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  317:                         #{label := Label,
  318:                           name := Pid,
  319:                           reason := {Reason, _Stack = [{M, F, Args, Location} | _]}}},
  320:                 level := Level}) ->
  321:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~30s~n",
  322:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  323:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Reason, undefined, M, F, Args, Location]]);
  324: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  325:                         #{label := Label,
  326:                          format := Format,
  327:                          args := Args}},
  328:                 meta := #{pid := Pid},
  329:                 level := Level}) ->
  330:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~150s~n",
  331:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  332:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label]] ++ [io_lib:format(Format, Args)]);
  333: process_event(E) ->
  334:     io_lib:format("~n||RAW event||~n~p~n", [E]).
  335: 
  336: format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level) ->
  337:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  338:     Id = get_value(id, Properties),
  339:     {M, F, Args} = get_mfa_value(Properties),
  340:     RestartType = get_value(restart_type, Properties),
  341:     Significant = get_value(significant, Properties),
  342:     io_lib:format("[~30s <- ~10s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~20s ~25s~n",
  343:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  344:                       E <- [Supervisor, Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args,
  345:                             Significant, RestartType]]).
  346: 
  347: get_mfa_value(Properties) ->
  348:     case get_value(mfargs, Properties) of
  349:         {mfargs, MFA} ->
  350:             MFA;
  351:         false ->
  352:             {mfa, MFA} = get_value(mfa, Properties),
  353:             MFA
  354:     end.
  355: 
  356: get_value(Key, List) ->
  357:     case lists:keyfind(Key, 1, List) of
  358:         R = false ->
  359:             ct:log("Key ~p not found in~n~p", [Key, List]),
  360:             R;
  361:         R -> R
  362:     end.
  363: 
  364: print_interesting_events([], Cnt) ->
  365:     {ok, Cnt};
  366: print_interesting_events([#{level := Level} = Event | Tail], Cnt)
  367:   when Level /= info, Level /= notice ->
  368:     ct:log("------------~nInteresting event found:~n~p~n==========~n", [Event]),
  369:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt + 1);
  370: print_interesting_events([_|Tail], Cnt) ->
  371:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt).
  372: 
  373: verify_events(_TestCase, 0) -> ok;
  374: verify_events(no_sensitive_leak, 1) -> ok;
  375: verify_events(max_channels_option, 3) -> ok;
  376: verify_events(_TestCase, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0->
  377:     {fail, lists:flatten(
  378:              io_lib:format("unexpected event cnt: ~s",
  379:                            [integer_to_list(EventNumber)]))}.
  380: 
  381: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  382: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  383: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  384: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  385:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  386:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  387: 
  388: simple_exec_more_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  389:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  390:     %% more data received, SSH window adjust needs to be sent by client
  391:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 60000).
  392: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  393: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  394:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  395:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  396:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  397:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  398:                                             ]),
  399:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  400: 
  401: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  402: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  403:     Parent = self(),
  404:     F = fun() ->
  405:                 spawn_link(
  406:                   fun() ->
  407:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  408:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  409:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  410:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  411:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  412:                   end)
  413:         end,
  414:     Pid1 = F(),
  415:     Pid2 = F(),
  416:     receive
  417:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  418:     end,
  419:     receive
  420:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  421:     end.
  422: 
  423: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  424: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  425:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  426: 
  427: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  428:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  429: 
  430: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  431:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  432: 
  433: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  434:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  435:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  436: 
  437: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  438:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  439:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  440: 
  441: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  442:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  443:     {error, _Reason} =
  444:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  445: 
  446: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  447:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  448: 
  449:     {error, invalid_port} =
  450:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  451:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  452:                      {user, "foo"},
  453:                      {password, "morot"},
  454:                      {user_interaction, false},
  455:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  456:                     infinity),
  457: 
  458:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  459: 
  460: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  461:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  462: 
  463:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  464:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  465:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  466:                      {user, "foo"},
  467:                      {password, "morot"},
  468:                      {user_interaction, false},
  469:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  470:                    longer),
  471: 
  472:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  473: 
  474: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  475:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  476: 
  477:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  478:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  479:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  480:                      {user, "foo"},
  481:                      {password, "morot"},
  482:                      {user_interaction, false},
  483:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  484:                    -1),
  485: 
  486:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  487: 
  488: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  489:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  490: 
  491:     {error, invalid_options} =
  492:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  493:                     {user, "foo"},
  494:                     infinity),
  495: 
  496:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  497: 
  498: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  499: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  500:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  501: 
  502:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  503:     {error, _} =
  504:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  505:                     {user, "foo"},
  506:                     infinity),
  507: 
  508:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  509: 
  510: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  511:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  512: 
  513:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  514:     {error, _} =
  515:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  516:                     {user, "foo"},
  517:                     short),
  518: 
  519:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  520: 
  521: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  522:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  523: 
  524:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  525:     {error, _} =
  526:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  527:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  528:                     -1),
  529: 
  530:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  531: 
  532: %% All three args incorrect
  533: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  534:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  535: 
  536:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  537:     {error, _} =
  538:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  539:                     {user, "foo"},
  540:                     fortnight),
  541: 
  542:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  543: 
  544: daemon_start(Config) ->
  545:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  546:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  547:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  548:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  549: 
  550:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  551:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  552:                                              {password, "morot"},
  553:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  554:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  555: 
  556: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  557: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  558:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  559:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  560:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  561:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  562:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  563: 
  564: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  565: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  566:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  567:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  568:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  569:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  570:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  571:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  572: 
  573: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  574: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  575:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  576:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  577:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  578: 
  579: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  580: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  581:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  582:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  583:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  584:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  585:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  586: 
  587: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  588: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  589:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  590:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  591:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  592: 
  593: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  594: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  595:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  596:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  597:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  598: 				  "cat", infinity),
  599: 
  600:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  601:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  602:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  603: 
  604:     %% receive response to input
  605:     receive
  606: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  607: 	    ok
  608:     after 
  609: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  610:     end,
  611: 
  612:     %% receive close messages
  613:     receive
  614: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  615: 	    ok
  616:     after 
  617: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  618:     end,
  619:     receive
  620: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  621: 	    ok
  622:     after 
  623: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  624:     end,
  625:     receive
  626: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  627: 	    ok
  628:     after 
  629: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  630:     end.
  631: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  632: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  633:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  634: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  635:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  636:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  637: 				  "cat", infinity),
  638: 
  639:     %% build 10MB binary
  640:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  641: 
  642:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  643:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  644:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  645: 
  646:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  647:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  648: 	{ok, Data} ->
  649: 	    ok;
  650: 	{ok, Other} ->
  651: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  652: 		true ->
  653: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  654: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  655: 		false ->
  656: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  657: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  658: 	    end,
  659: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  660: 	Else ->
  661: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  662:     end,
  663: 
  664:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  665:     receive
  666: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  667: 	    ok 
  668:     after 
  669: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  670:     end,
  671:     receive
  672: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  673: 	    ok
  674:     after 
  675: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  676:     end.
  677: 
  678: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  679: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  680:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  681:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  682:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  683: 
  684:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  685:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  686: 				  "false", infinity),
  687:     receive
  688: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  689: 	    ok
  690:     after 
  691: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  692:     end,
  693:     receive
  694: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  695: 	    ok
  696:     after 
  697: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  698:     end,
  699:     receive
  700: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  701: 	    ok
  702:     after 
  703: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  704:     end,
  705:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  706: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  707: 	ok ->
  708: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  709: 	{error, timeout} ->
  710: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  711: 	Else ->
  712: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  713:     end.
  714: 
  715: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  716: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  717:     Tags =
  718:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  719:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  720:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  721:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  722:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  723:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  724:     Opts =
  725:         lists:zip(Tags,
  726:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  727:     
  728:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  729:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  730:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  731:                 Opts ->
  732:                     ok;
  733:                 Other ->
  734:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  735:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  736:             end;
  737:         Other ->
  738:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  739:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  740:     end.
  741: 
  742: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  743: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  744:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  745:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  746:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  747:                  true -> success;
  748:                  false -> failure
  749:              end,
  750:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  751:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  752: 
  753: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  754: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  755:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  756:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  757:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  758:                  true -> success;
  759:                  false -> failure
  760:              end,
  761:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  762:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  763:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  764: 
  765: 
  766: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  767: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  768:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  769:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  770:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  771:                  true -> success;
  772:                  false -> failure
  773:              end,
  774:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  775:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  776:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  777: 
  778: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  779: %%- small_interrupted_send is interrupted by ssh_echo_server which is
  780: %%  done with transferring data towards client and terminates the
  781: %%  channel (this results with {error, closed} return value from
  782: %%  ssh_connection:send on the client side)
  783: %%- interrupted_send used to be interrupted when ssh_echo_server ran
  784: %%  out of data window and closed channel
  785: %%- but with automatic window adjustment, above condition is not taking
  786: %%  place, so ssh_echo_server continues sending data until it is done
  787: %%- so ssh_connection:send returns 'ok'
  788: small_interrupted_send(Config) ->
  789:     K = 1024,
  790:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  791:     EchoSize = 4 * K,
  792:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, {error, closed}).
  793: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  794:     K = 1024,
  795:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  796:     EchoSize = 10 * K * K,
  797:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, ok).
  798: 
  799: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, SenderResult) ->
  800:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  801:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  802:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  803:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  804:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  805:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  806: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  807: 					     {password, "morot"},
  808: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  809:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  810:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  811: 						      {user, "foo"},
  812: 						      {password, "morot"},
  813: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  814: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  815:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  816:     %% build big binary
  817:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  818:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  819:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  820:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  821:     Parent = self(),
  822:     ResultPid = spawn(
  823: 		  fun() ->
  824: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  825: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  826: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  827: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  828: 			      success ->
  829: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  830: 				  Result =
  831: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  832: 				      of
  833: 					  ExpectedData ->
  834: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  835: 					      ok;
  836: 					  Other ->
  837: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  838: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  839: 				      catch
  840: 					  Class:Exception ->
  841: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  842: 				      end,
  843: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  844: 			      Other ->
  845: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  846: 			  end
  847: 		  end),
  848:     receive
  849: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  850: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  851: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  852: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  853: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  854: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  855: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  856: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  857: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  858: 			      end),
  859: 	    receive
  860: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  861: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  862: 		    {fail, Fail};
  863: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  864: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  865: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  866: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  867: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  868: 		    receive
  869: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  870: 			    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect :)",
  871:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  872: 			    ok;
  873: 			Msg ->
  874: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  875: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  876: 		    end;
  877: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  878: 		    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect, "
  879:                            "but client channel handler has not reported yet",
  880:                            [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  881: 		    receive
  882: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  883: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  884: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  885: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  886: 			    ok;
  887: 			Msg ->
  888: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  889: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  890: 		    end;
  891: 		Msg ->
  892: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  893: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  894: 	    end
  895:     end.
  896: 
  897: manual_window_handling(Config) ->
  898:     do_adjusted_send(Config, 10, ok).
  899: 
  900: auto_window_handling(Config) ->
  901:     do_adjusted_send(Config, 10, fail).
  902: 
  903: sender_loop(Parent, _ConnRef, _ChannelId, _Bin, 0) ->
  904:     Parent ! {self(), ok};
  905: sender_loop(Parent, ConnRef, ChannelId, Bin, Ctr) ->
  906:     SendBin = <<Ctr:32, Bin/binary>>,
  907:     ct:log("~p:~p Sending packet number ~p", [?MODULE, ?LINE, Ctr]),
  908:     ssh_connection:send(ConnRef, ChannelId, SendBin, 30000),
  909:     sender_loop(Parent, ConnRef, ChannelId, Bin, Ctr - 1).
  910: 
  911: mk_receive_loop_fun(ConnRef, ChannelId, RcvTmo, ReportAdjustFun) ->
  912:     fun(Continue, RcvCtr, 0) ->
  913:         receive
  914:             {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
  915:                 ct:log("~p:~p Received eof", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
  916:                 Continue(Continue, RcvCtr, 0);
  917:             {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {closed, ChannelId}} ->
  918:                 ct:log("~p:~p Peer closed the channel, closing", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
  919:                 ssh:close(ConnRef);
  920:             What ->
  921:                 ct:log("~p:~p What is this ~p?", [?MODULE, ?LINE, What]),
  922:                 Continue(Continue, RcvCtr, 0)
  923:         end;
  924:         (Continue, RcvCtr, ExpectedCtr) ->
  925:             receive
  926:                 {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Ctr:32, _/binary>> = Data}} when byte_size(Data) == 1024 ->
  927:                     ct:log("~p:~p Received back number ~p", [?MODULE, ?LINE, Ctr]),
  928:                     if ExpectedCtr /= Ctr ->
  929:                             ct:fail("Unexpected counter value: ~p (expected ~p)", [Ctr, ExpectedCtr]);
  930:                         true ->
  931:                             Continue(Continue, RcvCtr + 1, ExpectedCtr - 1)
  932:                     end;
  933:                 {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
  934:                     ct:fail("Unexpected eof");
  935:                 {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {closed,ChannelId}} ->
  936:                     ct:fail("Unexpected eof")
  937:             after RcvTmo ->
  938:                 ct:log("~p:~p After ~p packets should adjust window", [?MODULE, ?LINE, RcvCtr]),
  939: 
  940:                 %% This function will either send adjust_window message (if allowed)
  941:                 %% or send a message to the parent PID, which it does not expect
  942:                 %% The latter would mean that the sender sees our recv window as full
  943:                 %% as no auto-adjust happened
  944:                 ReportAdjustFun(),
  945:                 Continue(Continue, RcvCtr, ExpectedCtr)
  946:             end
  947:     end.
  948: 
  949: do_adjusted_send(Config, NPkts, IsAdjustOk) ->
  950:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  951:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  952:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  953:     PktSize = proplists:get_value(init_pkt_size, Config),
  954:     WHM = proplists:get_value(window_handling_mode, Config),
  955:     WinSize = proplists:get_value(init_win_size, Config),
  956:     SendSize = PktSize * NPkts,
  957:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  958:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [SendSize, [{dbg,true}]]},
  959:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  960:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  961: 					     {password, "morot"},
  962: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  963:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  964:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  965: 						      {user, "foo"},
  966: 						      {password, "morot"},
  967: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  968: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  969:     ct:log("~p:~p connected, ref ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE, ConnectionRef]),
  970:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  971:     Parent = self(),
  972:     ResultPid = spawn(
  973: 		  fun() ->
  974: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  975: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, WinSize, PktSize, infinity),
  976: 			  ct:log("~p:~p set window handling mode ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE, WHM]),
  977:                           ssh_connection:set_window_handling_mode(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, WHM),
  978: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  979: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  980: 			      success ->
  981: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  982:                                   ct:log("~p:~p Starting receiver loop", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
  983:                                   AdjTmo = proplists:get_value(adjust_timeout, Config, 0),
  984:                                   ReportAdjustFun =
  985:                                     if IsAdjustOk == ok ->
  986:                                         fun() ->
  987:                                             ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, WinSize)
  988:                                         end;
  989:                                     true ->
  990:                                         fun() -> Parent ! adjust_nok end
  991:                                     end,
  992:                                   LoopFun = mk_receive_loop_fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, AdjTmo, ReportAdjustFun),
  993:                                   Result = LoopFun(LoopFun, 0, NPkts),
  994: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  995: 			      Other ->
  996: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  997: 			  end
  998: 		  end),
  999:     ct:log("Client channel handler ~p~n", [ResultPid]),
 1000:     receive
 1001: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
 1002: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
 1003: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1004: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1005: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
 1006: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
 1007:             ct:log("~p:~p Starting to send data in 1Kib chunks", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
 1008:             %% Prepare the binary of (1 KiB - 4 bytes) size
 1009:             %% 4-byte counter is added when sending
 1010:             SendBin = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:duplicate(255, 0)>>,
 1011: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() -> sender_loop(Parent, ConnectionRef, ChannelId, SendBin, 10) end),
 1012:             ct:log("Sender pid ~p~n", [SenderPid]),
 1013:             receive
 1014:                 {ResultPid, result, Result} ->
 1015: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Receiver result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
 1016: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1017: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1018: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1019: 		    receive
 1020: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
 1021: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Sender result:  ~p",
 1022:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
 1023: 			    ok;
 1024: 			Msg ->
 1025: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Unexpected msg: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1026: 			    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
 1027: 		    end;
 1028: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
 1029:                     ct:log("~p:~p Sender result:  ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
 1030:                     receive
 1031: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
 1032: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Receiver result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
 1033: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1034: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1035: 			    ok;
 1036: 			Msg ->
 1037: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Unexpected msg: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1038: 			    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
 1039: 		    end;
 1040:                 Msg ->
 1041: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Unexpected msg: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1042: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1043:                     catch exit(ResultPid, terminate),
 1044:                     catch exit(SenderPid, terminate),
 1045: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
 1046:             end
 1047:     end.
 1048: 
 1049: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1050: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1051:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1052:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1053:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1054:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1055:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1056: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1057: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1058: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
 1059: 
 1060:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1061: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1062: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1063: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1064: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1065:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
 1066:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
 1067:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1068:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1069: 
 1070: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1071: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1072:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
 1073:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
 1074:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
 1075:                                ],
 1076:                        exp_output =>
 1077:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
 1078:                             <<"1> ">>,
 1079:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
 1080:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
 1081:                             <<"2> ">>],
 1082:                        unexp_output =>
 1083:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
 1084:                     Config).
 1085: 
 1086: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1087: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1088:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
 1089:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
 1090:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
 1091:                                ],
 1092:                        exp_output =>
 1093:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
 1094:                             <<"1> ">>,
 1095:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
 1096:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
 1097:                             <<"2> ">>,
 1098:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
 1099:                             <<"\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\e[J\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m \r\n  one_atom_please.\e[A\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b">>]},
 1100:                     Config).
 1101: 
 1102: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
 1103:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
 1104:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
 1105:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1106:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1107:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1108:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1109:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1110: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1111: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1112:                                              {subsystems, []},
 1113:                                              {keepalive, true},
 1114:                                              {nodelay, true},
 1115:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
 1116:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
 1117:                                                      end}
 1118:                                             ]),
 1119:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1120: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1121: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1122: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1123:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1124:     success =
 1125:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1126:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
 1127:                                   infinity),
 1128:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 1129:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
 1130:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
 1131:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
 1132:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
 1133:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
 1134:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
 1135: 
 1136:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1137:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1138: 
 1139: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------

 1149: 
 1150:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1151: 						      {user, "foo"},

 1268: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
 1269:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
 1270:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1271:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1272:                                           end)
 1273:                             end,
 1274:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\r\n">>, 0,
 1275:                             Config).
 1276: 
 1277: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
 1278:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
 1279:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1280:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1281:                                           end)
 1282:                             end,
 1283:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\r\n">>, 0,
 1284:                             Config).
 1285: 
 1286: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
 1287:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
 1288:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1289:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1290:                                           end)
 1291:                             end,
 1292:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\r\n">>, 0,
 1293:                             Config).
 1294: 
 1295: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
 1296:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
 1297:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1298:                             Config).
 1299: 
 1300: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
 1301:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1302:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1303:                             Config).
 1304: 
 1305: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1306:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1307:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1308:                             Config).
 1309: 
 1310: start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data(Config) ->
 1311:     N = 60000,
 1312:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1313:     ReceiveFun =
 1314:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, _Expect, _ExpectType) ->
 1315:                 receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1316:                               N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1317:         end,
 1318:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct,
 1319:                              fun(_Cmd) ->
 1320:                                      {ok,
 1321:                                       [io_lib:format("testing~n",[]) ||
 1322:                                           _ <- lists:seq(1, N)]}
 1323:                              end},
 1324:                             "not_relevant", <<"not_used\n">>, 0,
 1325:                             ReceiveFun,
 1326:                             Config).
 1327: 
 1328: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1329:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1330:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1331:                             Config).
 1332: 
 1333: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1334:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1335:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1336:                             Config).
 1337: 
 1338: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1339:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1340:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1341:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1342:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1343:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1344: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1345: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1346: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1347: 
 1348:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1349:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1350:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1351:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1352:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1353: 
 1354:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1355: 
 1356:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1357:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\r\n">>}}),
 1358: 
 1359:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1360:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1361:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\r\n">>}}),
 1362: 
 1363:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1364:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1365:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1366:     receive
 1367:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1368:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1369:     end,
 1370:     receive
 1371:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1372:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1373:     end,
 1374:     receive
 1375:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1376:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1377:     end,
 1378:     receive
 1379:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1380:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1381:     after 0 -> go_on
 1382:     end,
 1383:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1384: 
 1385: 
 1386: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1387:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1388:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1389:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1390:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1391:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1392: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1393: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1394: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1395: 
 1396:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1397:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1398:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1399:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1400:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1401: 
 1402:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1403: 
 1404:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1405:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\r\n">>}}),
 1406: 
 1407:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1408:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1409:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\r\n">>}}),
 1410: 
 1411:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1412:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1413:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1414:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1415:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1416:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\r\n">>}}),
 1417:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1418:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1419:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1420:     receive
 1421:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1422:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1423:     end,
 1424:     receive
 1425:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1426:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1427:     end,
 1428:     receive
 1429:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1430:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1431:     end,
 1432:     receive
 1433:         X -> ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X]),
 1434:         ct:fail("remaining messages")
 1435:     after 0 -> go_on
 1436:     end,
 1437:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1438: 
 1439: 
 1440: 
 1441:     
 1442: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1443: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1444:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1445:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1446: 
 1447: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1448:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1449:         {ok, quit} ->
 1450:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1451:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1452:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1453:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1454:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1455:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1456:     end.
 1457:     
 1458: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1459: 
 1460: 
 1461: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1462:     DefaultReceiveFun =
 1463:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType) ->
 1464:                 receive
 1465:                     {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1466:                         ok
 1467:                 after 5000 ->
 1468:                         receive
 1469:                             Other ->
 1470:                                 ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1471:                                        [Other,
 1472:                                         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 1473:                                          {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1474:                                          %% {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1475:                                 ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1476:                         after 0 ->
 1477:                                 ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1478:                         end
 1479:                 end
 1480:         end,
 1481:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, DefaultReceiveFun, Config).
 1482: 
 1483: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, ReceiveFun, Config) ->
 1484:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1485:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1486:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1487:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1488:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1489: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1490: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1491: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1492: 
 1493:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1494: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1495: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1496: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1497: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1498: 
 1499:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1500:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Command, infinity),
 1501:     ReceiveFun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType),
 1502:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1503:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1504: 
 1505: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1506: %% Issue GH-8223
 1507: trap_exit_connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1508:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1509:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1510:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1511:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1512:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1513:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1514:                                              {password, "morot"}]),
 1515:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1516:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1517:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1518: 
 1519:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1520:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1521:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1522:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1523:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1524:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1525:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1526:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1527: 
 1528:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1529:     receive
 1530:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1531:     after 0 ->
 1532:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1533:     end.
 1534: 
 1535: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1536: %% Issue GH-8223
 1537: trap_exit_daemon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1538:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1539:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1540:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1541:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1542: 
 1543:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1544:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1545:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1546: 
 1547:     {ok, DaemonRef} = ssh:daemon(0, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1548:                                      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1549:     ssh:stop_daemon(DaemonRef),
 1550: 
 1551:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1552:     receive
 1553:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1554:     after 0 ->
 1555:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1556:     end.
 1557: 
 1558: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1559: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1560:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1561:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1562:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1563:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1564:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1565:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1566:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1567:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1568:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1569: 
 1570:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1571:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1572:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1573: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1574: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1575: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1576: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1577: 
 1578:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1579: 
 1580:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1581: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1582: 
 1583:     receive
 1584: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1585: 	    ok
 1586:     after 5000 ->
 1587: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1588:     end,
 1589: 
 1590:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1591:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1592: 
 1593: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1594: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1595:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1596:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1597:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1598:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1599: 
 1600:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1601:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1602:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1603: 
 1604:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1605:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1606: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1607: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1608: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1609: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1610: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1611: 	       end),
 1612: 
 1613:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1614:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1615:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1616:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1617: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1618: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1619: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1620: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1621: 
 1622:     %% And runs some commands
 1623:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1624: 
 1625:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1626: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1627: 
 1628:     receive
 1629: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1630: 	    ok
 1631:     after 5000 ->
 1632: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1633:     end,
 1634: 
 1635:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1636: 
 1637: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1638: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1639:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1640:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1641:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1642:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1643: 
 1644:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1645: 
 1646:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1647:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1648:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1649: 
 1650:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1651:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1652:                   {password, "morot"},
 1653:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1654: 
 1655:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1656:     Pids =
 1657:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1658:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1659:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1660:                     end)
 1661:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1662:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1663: 
 1664:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1665:     ConnectionRefs =
 1666:         [begin
 1667:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1668:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1669:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1670:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1671:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1672:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1673:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1674:              ConnectionRef
 1675:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1676:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1677: 
 1678:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1679:     Parent = self(),
 1680:     ClientPids =
 1681:         lists:map(
 1682:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1683:                   spawn_link(
 1684:                     fun() ->
 1685:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1686:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1687:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1688:                             receive
 1689:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1690:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1691:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1692:                             after 5000 ->
 1693:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1694:                             end
 1695:                     end)
 1696:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1697:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1698: 
 1699:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1700:                           receive
 1701:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1702:                           end
 1703:                   end, ClientPids),
 1704:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1705: 
 1706:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1707: 
 1708: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1709: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1710:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1711:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1712:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1713:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1714:     
 1715:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1716:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1717:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1718: 
 1719:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1720:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1721:     receive
 1722: 	Verstring ->
 1723: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1724: 	    receive
 1725: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1726: 		    ok
 1727: 	    end
 1728:     after 
 1729: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1730:     end.
 1731:
